cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.PR, cs.CC. 

The paper discusses techniques for bounding the mixing time of Markov chains, which is a topic in computer science related to algorithms and probability. The paper also mentions specific applications such as sampling 0/1 knapsack solutions and perfect and near-perfect matchings, which suggest a focus on discrete structures and combinatorial optimization. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), followed by cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.PR (Probability), and cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
